title: Safe Reptile Consumption Guidelines
brief: Identify safe reptiles for food while avoiding toxic species like box turtles and hawksbills.
steps: Step 1: Know that most reptiles are safe protein sources and relatively easy to catch.
Step 2: AVOID box turtles - they feed on poisonous mushrooms and build up toxic poison in flesh.
Step 3: AVOID hawksbill turtles found in Atlantic Ocean due to poisonous thorax gland.
Step 4: Exercise extreme caution with poisonous snakes, alligators, crocodiles, and large sea turtles.
Step 5: Cook reptiles when possible, though they can be eaten raw in emergencies.
Step 6: Understand that reptiles don't carry warm-blooded animal diseases due to being cold-blooded.
warnings: Box turtle toxin is not destroyed by cooking - avoid completely.
Poisonous snakes and large reptiles present obvious physical dangers.
While reptiles can be eaten raw, cooking eliminates parasite risk.
Positive identification is crucial - when in doubt, don't consume.
